description: A 16' pedal reed stop, similar to the Trombone but, according to Audsley, softer. Wedgwood report that it has closed shallots. Used by French and Belgian builders, including Anneessens. Examples We know of only two examples: Tubasson 16', Pedal; Bridlington Priory, Yorkshire, England; Anneessens 1889. Tubasson 8', Pédale; St. Josefkerk, Aalst, Belgium; Vereecken 1900. Bibliography Audsley[1]: Tubasson. Sumner[1]: Tubasson. Wedgwood[1]: Tubasson. FOOTER Original website compiled by Edward L. Stauff. For educational use only.
